SEARCH
Package io.github.jspinak.brobot.actions.methods.basicactions.find.color.pixelAnalysis

Class AnalyzePixels

java.lang.Object
io.github.jspinak.brobot.actions.methods.basicactions.find.color.pixelAnalysis.AnalyzePixels
@Component public class AnalyzePixels extends Object
This class is a central location for pixel analysis, for every color-based match strategy.

  • Method Details

    • getPixelAnalysisCollection

      public PixelAnalysisCollection getPixelAnalysisCollection(Scene scene, StateImage stateImage, ActionOptions actionOptions)
      First, PixelAnalysis is performed on each scene with the ColorProfiles for the StateImage_. This gives us the similarity of each pixel to the color profiles. Using this information, scores are calculated that tell us how likely the pixel is to belong to this StateImage_. Pixel analysis is done on the entire scene first, without accounting for the search regions. It can then be reused for subsequent searches.
      Parameters:
      scene - The scene to analyze.
      stateImage - The state image object to analyze.
      actionOptions - The action configuration.
      Returns:
      The pixel scores for the scene.

    • setPixelAnalyses

      public PixelAnalysisCollection setPixelAnalyses(Scene scene, List<ColorCluster> colorClusters)
      Create a PixelAnalysis for each ColorProfile. PixelAnalysis records the similarity between pixels in the scene and a ColorProfile.
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene to analyze
      colorClusters - the color profiles to use
      Returns:
      a PixelAnalysisCollection containing the PixelAnalyses

    • getAnalysisForOneScene

      public SceneAnalysis getAnalysisForOneScene(Scene scene, Set<StateImage> targetImgs, Set<StateImage> allImgs, ActionOptions actionOptions)
      A SceneAnalysis comprises all analysis of a scene, for which there may be multiple StateImage_s. A PixelAnalysisCollection comprises all analysis of a {scene, StateImage_} pair. A SceneAnalysis therefore can hold a collection of PixelAnalysisCollections. There is a one-to-many relationship between scenes and StateImage_s. Having a PixelAnalysisCollection for each StateImage_, we can then compare the scores for each pixel to determine which StateImage_ the pixel belongs to.
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene to analyze
      allImgs - the images to match with the pixels in the scene
      actionOptions - the action configuration
      Returns:
      a SceneAnalysis, containing a PixelsAnalysisCollection for each StateImage_
